meanings.definition: A portion or share of something, especially money or food, given out to someone in need.
meanings.sent1: The kind lady gave a dole of food to the hungry child.
meanings.sent2: The government provides a monthly dole to the unemployed.
meanings.sent3: The dole of coins in the beggar's cup brought a smile to his face.
meanings.sent4: She received a dole of vegetables from the community garden.
meanings.sent5: The dole of bread was a lifeline for the starving family.

meanings.definition: To distribute or give out in small portions.
meanings.sent1: The teacher will dole out the crayons to each student.
meanings.sent2: Please dole the candies evenly among the children.
meanings.sent3: He likes to dole out compliments to make people happy.
meanings.sent4: The chef will dole out samples of the new dish to the customers.
meanings.sent5: The supervisor will dole out tasks to the team members.

meanings.sent1: They dole out blankets to the homeless during winter.
meanings.sent2: The organization will dole out funds to support the cause.
meanings.sent3: She likes to dole out hugs to everyone she meets.
meanings.sent4: The volunteers will dole out care packages to those in need.
meanings.sent5: The kind lady will dole out smiles to brighten people's days.
